abstract: Writer Katherine Heiny has emerged with short story collection Single, Carefree, Mellow after two decades of obscurity; collection, which follows periods of writing under pseudonym and motherhood, also marks return to writing adult fiction.
lead_paragraph: Katherine Heiny’s short-story collection “Single, Carefree, Mellow” is billed as a debut of sorts, but the road has been long: She was published in The New Yorker at age 25 and has written for young adults under a pseudonym.

headline.main: From Early Triumph, to Toil, to Vindication
headline.print_headline: From Early Triumph, to Toil, to Vindication
headline.seo: Katherine Heiny’s Road to ‘Single, Carefree, Mellow’

snippet: Katherine Heiny’s short-story collection “Single, Carefree, Mellow” is billed as a debut of sorts, but the road has been long: She was published in The New Yorker at age 25 and has written for young adults under a pseudonym.
